item.title: Federal judge strikes down Trump order targeting the law firm Perkins Coie
item.description: The ruling from U.S. District Judge Beryl Howell is the first to permanently block an executive order issued by President Trump punishing a law firm for representing clients or causes he dislikes.

item.title: The Trump administration says it will cut EPA staffing to Reagan-era levels
item.description: EPA announced plans to reorganize the agency, moving science-focused staff into different roles and reducing the overall number of employees.

item.title: Australians vote in election, with high prices and housing shortage major issues
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's center-left Labor Party is seeking a second term. His opponent, conservative opposition leader Peter Dutton, wants to become the first political leader to oust a first-term government since 1931.

item.title: Man sentenced to 53 years in prison in attack on Palestinian American boy, mother
item.description: An Illinois landlord who killed a 6-year-old Muslim boy and severely injured the boy's mother in a brutal hate-crime attack days after the war in Gaza began was sentenced to 53 years in prison.

item.title: Radio Free Asia announces mass layoffs amid funding fight with Trump administration
item.description: Radio Free Asia is laying off about 90 percent of its staff. It says it can no longer pay people after its funding was cut off by the Trump administration.

item.title: He let snakes bite him some 200 times to create a better snakebite antivenom
item.description: Scientists have created a broadly effective antivenom using the blood of a Wisconsin man who has spent years exposing himself to deadly snakebites from black mambas, taipans, cobras and many others.

item.title: Germany's domestic intelligence labels right-wing AfD party as extremist
item.description: Germany's domestic intelligence agency has formally designated the Alternative for Germany party as extremist, a move likely to further isolate the country's largest opposition party.

item.title: What Will Happen to Russian-Occupied Territories in Ukraine?
item.description: At the heart of a potential peace deal between Russia and Ukraine is what, if any, Ukrainian territory Russia will be allowed to keep. Moscow asserts that four Ukrainian provinces are more culturally Russian than Ukrainian. We go to one of those areas to find out what the people there think.

item.title: An Australian woman is on trial for murder by toxic mushrooms. Here's what to know
item.description: Erin Patterson hosted several of her estranged husband's relatives for lunch in July 2023. Within days, three of them were dead of mushroom poisoning. She denies deliberately poisoning them.
